python-vim http://vimdoc.sourceforge.net/htmldoc/if_pyth.html#python-vim

vim - pass argument to python script 

:py import sys
:py sys.argv = ["foo", "bar"]
:pyfile mypythonscript.py

" pass argument with variable
function! Markdown2HTML()
        python import sys; import vim; sys.argv = [vim.eval("a:arg"), "bar"]
	pyfile markdown2html.py
endfunc

vim - get input from user 

function! Demo()
  let curline = getline('.')
  call inputsave()
  let name = input('Enter name: ')
  call inputrestore()
  call setline('.', curline . ' ' . name)
endfunction

vim - execute by python script 

if !has('python')
	finish
endif
 
function! Markdown2HTML()
	pyfile markdown2html.py
endfunc
 
command! MKD2HTML call Markdown2HTML()

http://www.terminally-incoherent.com/blog/2013/05/06/vriting-vim-plugins-in-python/ vim - redraw screen 

:redraw!

vim - loop 

:let c = 0
:for i in [1, 2, 3, 4]
:  let c += i
:endfor
:echom c

:let c = 1
:let total = 0
:while c <= 4
:  let total += c
:  let c += 1
:endwhile
:echom total

command! -nargs=1 MyCommand call s:MyFunc(<f-args>)

vim - if else 

:if 10 == 11
:    echom "first"
:elseif 10 == 10
:    echom "second"
:endif

:if "foo" == "bar"
:    echom "one"
:elseif "foo" == "foo"
:    echom "two"
:endif

vim - write a function 

:function DisplayName(name)
:  echom "Hello!  My name is:"
:  echom a:name
:endfunction

vim - run the function 

:call DisplayName("Your Name")
